_header: Maiden and mother that bore the heaven king
Subjects: Virgin Mary and Christ, songs/prayers to
_description: A prayer to the Virgin Mary and Jesus — five couplets

BLCottCleoBVI.First Lines:
Maidin and moder þat bar þe heuene kingeWer us fro ure
                    wyþer wines at ure hending…
BLCottCleoBVI.Last Lines:
…Ihesu for þi moder inne and for þin hali
                    wndisþu leise us of þi sinnes þat we are in ne
                    bunde
BLCottCleoBVI.Note:
The MS has been refoliated several times. The folio number here refers
                    to the most recent, written in the bottom right corner of each recto folio.
                    Written as prose.
BLCottCleoBVI.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.22.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932: 127.
